commit.message:
ChangeLog (configure.in): Don't include ansidecl.h in tconfig.h.

	* ChangeLog (configure.in): Don't include ansidecl.h in tconfig.h.
	* gcov-io.h (PARAMS, ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED: Define if IN_LIBGCC2.
	* unwind-dw2-fde.h (last_fde): Use __attribute__, not
	ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED.

	* configure: Regenerate.

From-SVN: r61692

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,12 @@
+2003-01-23  Kaveh R. Ghazi  <ghazi@caip.rutgers.edu>
+
+	* ChangeLog (configure.in): Don't include ansidecl.h in tconfig.h.
+	* gcov-io.h (PARAMS, ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED: Define if IN_LIBGCC2.
+	* unwind-dw2-fde.h (last_fde): Use __attribute__, not
+	ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED.
+
+	* configure: Regenerate.
+
 2003-01-23  Franz Sirl  <Franz.Sirl-kernel@lauterbach.com>
 
 	PR java/6748

@@ -5572,7 +5572,8 @@ tm_file="${tm_file} defaults.h"
 tm_p_file="${tm_p_file} tm-preds.h"
 host_xm_file="auto-host.h ansidecl.h ${host_xm_file}"
 build_xm_file="${build_auto} ansidecl.h ${build_xm_file}"
-xm_file="ansidecl.h ${xm_file}"
+# We don't want ansidecl.h in target files, write code there in ISO/GNU C.
+#xm_file="ansidecl.h ${xm_file}"
 
 # Truncate the target if necessary
 if test x$host_truncate_target != x; then
@@ -5629,14 +5630,14 @@ fi
 
             
 echo $ac_n "checking for library containing strerror""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5633: checking for library containing strerror" >&5
+echo "configure:5634: checking for library containing strerror" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_search_strerror'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_func_search_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 ac_cv_search_strerror="no"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5640 "configure"
+#line 5641 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5647,7 +5648,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5651: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5652: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_search_strerror="none required"
 else
@@ -5658,7 +5659,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
 test "$ac_cv_search_strerror" = "no" && for i in cposix; do
 LIBS="-l$i  $ac_func_search_save_LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5662 "configure"
+#line 5663 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5669,7 +5670,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5673: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5674: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_search_strerror="-l$i"
 break
@@ -5692,12 +5693,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5696: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:5697: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5701 "configure"
+#line 5702 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -5746,7 +5747,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5750: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5751: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -5767,12 +5768,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5771: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5772: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5776 "configure"
+#line 5777 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5800,12 +5801,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5804: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5805: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5809 "configure"
+#line 5810 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5835,19 +5836,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5839: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5840: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5844 "configure"
+#line 5845 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5851: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5852: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -5868,12 +5869,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5872: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:5873: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5877 "configure"
+#line 5878 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -5901,7 +5902,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5905: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5906: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -5933,12 +5934,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5937: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:5938: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5942 "configure"
+#line 5943 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -5963,12 +5964,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5967: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:5968: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5972 "configure"
+#line 5973 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5991,7 +5992,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5995: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5996: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6018,15 +6019,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6022: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6023: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6030 "configure"
+#line 6031 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -6045,7 +6046,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6049: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:6050: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -6068,12 +6069,12 @@ fi
 
 
     echo $ac_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6072: checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer" >&5
+echo "configure:6073: checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_gnu_library_2_1'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6077 "configure"
+#line 6078 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <features.h>
@@ -6109,17 +6110,17 @@ stdlib.h string.h unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6113: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6114: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6118 "configure"
+#line 6119 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6123: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6124: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6150,12 +6151,12 @@ getgid getuid mempcpy munmap putenv setenv setlocale stpcpy strchr strcasecmp \
 strdup strtoul tsearch __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6154: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6155: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6159 "configure"
+#line 6160 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6178,7 +6179,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6182: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6183: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6219,15 +6220,15 @@ fi
 
 
   echo $ac_n "checking for iconv""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6223: checking for iconv" >&5
+echo "configure:6224: checking for iconv" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_func_iconv'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   
     am_cv_func_iconv="no, consider installing GNU libiconv"
     am_cv_lib_iconv=no
     cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6231 "configure"
+#line 6232 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <iconv.h>
@@ -6237,7 +6238,7 @@ iconv_t cd = iconv_open("","");
        iconv_close(cd);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6241: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6242: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_func_iconv=yes
 else
@@ -6249,7 +6250,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
       am_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
       LIBS="$LIBS $am_cv_libiconv_ldpath -liconv"
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6253 "configure"
+#line 6254 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <iconv.h>
@@ -6259,7 +6260,7 @@ iconv_t cd = iconv_open("","");
          iconv_close(cd);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6263: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6264: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_lib_iconv=yes
         am_cv_func_iconv=yes
@@ -6280,13 +6281,13 @@ echo "$ac_t""$am_cv_func_iconv" 1>&6
 EOF
 
     echo $ac_n "checking for iconv declaration""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6284: checking for iconv declaration" >&5
+echo "configure:6285: checking for iconv declaration" >&5
     if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_proto_iconv'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6290 "configure"
+#line 6291 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdlib.h>
@@ -6305,7 +6306,7 @@ int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6309: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6310: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_proto_iconv_arg1=""
 else
@@ -6334,19 +6335,19 @@ EOF
 
    
   echo $ac_n "checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6338: checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET" >&5
+echo "configure:6339: checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_langinfo_codeset'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6343 "configure"
+#line 6344 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <langinfo.h>
 int main() {
 char* cs = nl_langinfo(CODESET);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6350: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6351: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_langinfo_codeset=yes
 else
@@ -6369,19 +6370,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6373: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:6374: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6378 "configure"
+#line 6379 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6385: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6386: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -6402,7 +6403,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6406: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:6407: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -6425,7 +6426,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6429: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:6430: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -6445,17 +6446,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6449: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6450: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6454 "configure"
+#line 6455 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6459: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6460: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6476,12 +6477,12 @@ if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
 EOF
 
            echo $ac_n "checking for GNU gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6480: checking for GNU gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:6481: checking for GNU gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6485 "configure"
+#line 6486 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 extern int _nl_msg_cat_cntr;
@@ -6490,7 +6491,7 @@ bindtextdomain ("", "");
 return (int) gettext ("") + _nl_msg_cat_cntr
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6494: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6495: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc=yes
 else
@@ -6506,14 +6507,14 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for GNU gettext in libintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6510: checking for GNU gettext in libintl" >&5
+echo "configure:6511: checking for GNU gettext in libintl" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libintl'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   gt_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 		LIBS="$LIBS -lintl $LIBICONV"
 		cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6517 "configure"
+#line 6518 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 extern int _nl_msg_cat_cntr;
@@ -6522,7 +6523,7 @@ bindtextdomain ("", "");
 return (int) gettext ("") + _nl_msg_cat_cntr
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6526: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6527: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libintl=yes
 else
@@ -6555,12 +6556,12 @@ EOF
 	     for ac_func in dcgettext
 do

 /* Functions for reading and writing gcov files.  */
